intro: Athamanta cortiana, commonly known as the Sierra Madre dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Athamanta cortiana is often found in open woodlands and along canyon walls, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
